snippet: After the Triple Crown contender I’ll Have Another was scratched, Union Rags won the Belmont Stakes in impressive fashion to join Bodemeister at the top of the 3-year-old class.
abstract: Joe Drape On Horse Racing column questions whether Belmont Stakes winner Union Rags can make fans forget about I'll Have Another, Kentucky Derby and Preakness winner who was scratched from Triple Crown bid with a touch of tendinitis in his left front leg; notes that the Travers Stakes, also known as the Midsummer Derby, is next on the radar for Union Rags.
lead_paragraph: After the Triple Crown contender I’ll Have Another was scratched, Union Rags won the Belmont Stakes in impressive fashion to join Bodemeister at the top of the 3-year-old class.

headline.print_headline: A Performance That Quelled Doubts and Tempered Sadness
headline.seo: Belmont Stakes Still Impressive, Even Without I’ll Have Another
headline.main: A Performance That Quelled Doubts and Tempered Sadness
